meanings.definition: The amount that a thimble can hold.
meanings.sent1: She poured thimblefuls of water into the tiny cup.
meanings.sent2: Grandma only needed a few thimblefuls of sugar for her tea.
meanings.sent3: The ants carried thimblefuls of sugar back to their tiny home.
meanings.sent4: His heart was filled with thimblefuls of love for his family.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully measured thimblefuls of spices for the recipe.

meanings.sent1: The child only ate thimblefuls of vegetables at dinner.
meanings.sent2: She added thimblefuls of milk to her coffee to lighten it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored thimblefuls of nuts in its cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was filled with thimblefuls of creative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The artist used thimblefuls of paint to create a masterpiece.
